title: This Is Why People Complain About Dynamic Q
body: Trundle, Ezreal, & Nami were all premade (I know because same club tag, also keep in mind this is in Diamond so max trio q.) They out-roated my team and played an insane split push game that was only possible since they were on voice comm (pretty obvious since they were premade and the derisiveness of the calls). Heres were the fun part is to my knowledge there were ZERO PREMADES on my team (didn't see any matching club tags on my side). So now its 5 RANDOMS vs a TRIO how in the fuck is that fair? Why do they get to have more influence on the game than any of us solos? I had to try to explain to my team that we had to give an inhib and try to fight the 4v5 but they wouldn't budge they walk between mid and top in the end losing both inhibs without getting anything done. I tried my best to carry that game I really did but in the end 1 < 3.

replies.body: It's not fair. This is a massive problem with Dynamic Queue and premades. The quality of teamwork in a premade is much higher and honestly, I don't think it can ever be fair when it comes to playing with larger groups. A group that has played together for a long time will have a massive advantage that cannot be measured by MMR. Sadly, they still do not let you opt out of being matched with premades.

You don't have to remove names from your match history. People can literally just go to your match history...

Or am I mistaken? =/
Of course they could I'm just being courteous to the other players. If you want to put in the effort to look at my match history and find the other players hey more power to you.

I don't care about the fairness of DQ, although it probably is fucked sometimes yeah. But let's face it solo queue also had problems in that regard; it's always going to be partly based on luck.

I just hate Dynamic Queue as a concept. I don't think it should exist in a competitive environment, which is what ranked is supposed to be (at least past Gold). Trying to merge Ranked 5s and Solo Queue into one was just a recipe for disaster right from the start.

> [{quoted}](name=Xenos11111,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=37VUuZBR,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-06-17T10:13:11.706+0000)
>
it's always going to be partly based on luck.

i was very lucky to reach master, so was every high elo players, despite smurfing and getting back to it again again and again.

I don't mean in general. I mean in the case of each single game. It's partly influenced by luck and also influenced by your own skill. Obviously over 100+ games luck becomes pretty much a non-factor, but that's not what I was referring to.

Also, if you're Master then why are you posting on a smurf? 56% win rate in Gold doesn't look like a Master player to me.
High elo is a trainwreck now. I recommend smurfing only this season.
I feel like the only way dynamic queue can be made to work is if there are an equal amount of premades on both sides.
You can't know that your teamates weren't premade for sure. You're not forced to have the same club tag to premade (maybe you should be though).

You're looking at this completely the wrong way.  Let me rephrase this: what are the odds of three people on the enemy team (60%!) having the same clan tag, belonging to the same group of, at most 50 people-- though I usually see clans with 5-10, 20 at most-- and not being a premade, or not being in voice comms upon realizing they magically got into a ranked game with their two (suspiciously also the max premade cap at that Elo) friends?

> [{quoted}](name=PB4UAME,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=37VUuZBR,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2016-06-17T20:21:53.076+0000)
>
> You're looking at this completely the wrong way.  Let me rephrase this: what are the odds of three people on the enemy team (60%!) having the same clan tag, belonging to the same group of, at most 50 people-- though I usually see clans with 5-10, 20 at most-- and not being a premade, or not being in voice comms upon realizing they magically got into a ranked game with their two (suspiciously also the max premade cap at that Elo) friends?

They are definitely premade, thats not up for debate. The issue is that you can't assume that you do't have a 3 man premade or a pair of 2 man premades on your own team, just because they don't have the same tags. If you ask them they can just lie and you can't prove anything. The system is designed to match up premade vs premade as evenly as possible, so in the end all you have is your own paranoia that only the enemy team has a premade which conflicts with how the system works.

>which conflicts with how the system~~ works~~ is supposed to work.

Fixed that. Theoretically, the system tries to match premades vs premades, but practiacally it changes the parameters the longer you are in que to prevent absurdly long que times, so in high elos it actually happens quite frequently that soloplayers face premades in order to keep que time 'reasonable'(still quite long though)
This is statistically proven for master/challenger http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/4tsuGXEq-dynamic-queue-statistics-for-61977-matches

At highest elos, the player base grows so thin that it can get hard for the system to find another fitting 3 man premade or two duos.

> [{quoted}](name=The Sword Dancer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=37VUuZBR,comment-id=000a00000000,timestamp=2016-06-17T21:02:36.117+0000)
>
> They are definitely premade, thats not up for debate. The issue is that you can't assume that you do't have a 3 man premade or a pair of 2 man premades on your own team, just because they don't have the same tags. If you ask them they can just lie and you can't prove anything. The system is designed to match up premade vs premade as evenly as possible, so in the end all you have is your own paranoia that only the enemy team has a premade which conflicts with how the system works.

Have to at least emphasize on this point, I duo normals with my friend all the time (solo ranked though; friend is plat so his MMR would far outstrip mine)

I don't have the same clan tag as him.

That said; I think its stupid that it essentially comes down to "whose premade is better" regardless., though that was how it always was (at least when we had old yolo queue and you could duo)

You got out-rotated and splitpushed by a Trundle with Zz'rot, and Nami with Zz'rot and Banner?
Okay.
Sure, communication helps, but it sounds more like they played their teamcomp well in general, and you just didn't have the proper teamcomp to handle it.

Thing is we could have won that game but the team just wouldn't listen to me. We force a 4v5 fight in turn forcing trundle to either take inhib or join the fight then seeing how it went from there but instead because we don't have as good communication my team choose to run between bot and top lane doing acomplishing nothing. There was an out to that game as there is to any game but not being on voice comms while they are really lowers the chances.
That sounds less like the opponent had an unfair advantage and more like you were held back by unrepsonsive teammates.

I agree.

Plus, considering that the losing team ended up getting more kills AND assists, the game seemed very close and fair as it was, even if the other team has communication.

It is not always a good thing. Last few games ive been going solo i get into 3 group teams.. I am in silver. I take ranked seriously, while yes i understand im not amazing i am trying to get better and i am climbing slowly. It is just a hindrance when your 3 group on your team does not use voice comms and is just on to troll. Meanwhile since we have a 3 group, the other team has a 4 group all in comms. Seems fair right?

I just want to opt out of playing with groups. It makes me sick playing with people who are intentionally feeding and griefing because they have friends in the game with them. 

last game i had a 3 group on my team. They ran around all game literally running into 5 of the enemy to fight them, no matter what anyone said. They would flash walls for "fun" and just general greifing. The game before that, the dude said they were premade. Thresh goes 1/16 bot lane and they are just laughing. 

It is so sad. Makes me bored of ranked. It seems 2/3 games go something like what i described. I wish they would change how you got lp. Make each game worth 25 lp and you get points for doing certain things. You get a good champ grade you get points, you lose game you lose points. idk if that would work i just know something needs to change.
or you get it where your 4 man team is an average 3 ranks lower than the enemy, and youre the only one at the same level as your opponents.
club names are only usable to see if there is, not if there isn't. for all you know there was a tri with you as well, but with different club tags.
Dead on. Losing a game is precisely why 99% of people complain about dynamic q.

I think it's funny that the elephant in the room is this:

DQ would work perfectly if the League community could actually voice comm with each other without raging like crazy. If you could invite the 4 other randoms (or even 2-3 of the randoms) into a curse voice client it already increases your effectiveness as a team, even without any practice, by a huge amount. But Riot has been loathe to add it due to the added toxicity and difficulty of management that that creates, and any attempt at creating an outside client has fallen flat (curse voice comes to mind as something that lasted for all of 10 seconds as a pick-up voice comm).

The League community isn't compatible with DQ, but I don't actually think it has a thing to do with DQ. It has more to do with the fact that League players will probably never start making attempts to voice comm without Riot adding it, and when they do add it so many people will probably be toxic so as to make the system useless. But it's just hilarious to me to watch these players complain to Riot about DQ when the problem is a community that refuses to communicate with their team, with some solo players taking it as far as never typing in game at all.
They are allowed to do this because everyone can do this. Riot's goal is to encourage all players to premade. Just hop on with a guy who played well last game, get on Curse Voice and climb.

so your saying that 1 more person then before just fucks your shit up and you cant do anything the world is ending cause holy shit 1 more person is on comms holy fuck. what about when people put curse tags in chat and got other people in coms where you freaking out then when they had comms. oh right no you wernt you just want something to complain about.
